storyTitle: As Employee, I want to filter my schedule by shift type to focus on relevant shifts

testCases.title: Validate filtering by single shift type
preconditions: Employee account exists and is active in the system
Employee is logged into the application
Employee has multiple shifts of different types assigned in their schedule
Schedule page is accessible and loads successfully
At least one predefined shift type exists in the system

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule page from the main dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Schedule page loads displaying all assigned shifts for the employee

steps.action: Locate the shift type filter control on the schedule page
steps.expectedResult: Shift type filter dropdown/selector is visible and accessible

steps.action: Click on the shift type filter control to view available shift types
steps.expectedResult: List of predefined shift types is displayed (e.g., Morning, Evening, Night, Weekend)

steps.action: Select a specific shift type from the filter options
steps.expectedResult: Selected shift type is highlighted or marked as active in the filter control

steps.action: Observe the schedule display update
steps.expectedResult: Schedule updates dynamically without full page reload to show only shifts matching the selected type within 3 seconds

steps.action: Verify that only shifts of the selected type are displayed
steps.expectedResult: All displayed shifts match the selected shift type; shifts of other types are hidden

steps.action: Locate and click the 'Clear filter' button or option
steps.expectedResult: Clear filter option is visible and clickable

steps.action: Observe the schedule display after clearing the filter
steps.expectedResult: Full schedule is displayed again showing all shifts of all types without page reload

postconditions: Employee remains logged in
Schedule displays all shifts without any active filters
Filter control is reset to default state
No error messages are displayed
System state is ready for next filter operation

testCases.title: Verify rejection of invalid shift type filter
preconditions: Employee account exists and is active in the system
Employee is logged into the application
Employee has access to the schedule page
Schedule page is loaded and displaying shifts
System has validation rules for shift type inputs

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule page
steps.expectedResult: Schedule page loads successfully with all assigned shifts visible

steps.action: Locate the shift type filter input field or control
steps.expectedResult: Shift type filter control is visible and accessible

steps.action: Attempt to input an invalid shift type (e.g., 'InvalidType123', special characters, or non-existent shift type)
steps.expectedResult: System accepts the input for validation processing

steps.action: Submit or apply the invalid shift type filter
steps.expectedResult: System validates the input and detects it as invalid

steps.action: Observe the system response
steps.expectedResult: Clear error message is displayed indicating the shift type is invalid (e.g., 'Invalid shift type. Please select from available options.')

steps.action: Verify that the filter was not applied to the schedule
steps.expectedResult: Schedule remains unchanged showing all shifts; invalid filter is not applied

steps.action: Verify the filter control state
steps.expectedResult: Filter control remains in its previous valid state or is cleared

postconditions: Employee remains logged in
Schedule displays all shifts without invalid filter applied
Error message is visible to guide the user
System remains stable with no crashes or unexpected behavior
Filter control is ready for valid input

storyTitle: As Employee, I want to search my schedule by date to quickly find specific shifts

testCases.title: Validate search by valid date
preconditions: Employee account exists and is active in the system
Employee is logged into the application
Employee has shifts scheduled on various dates
Schedule page is accessible and functional
Date search functionality is enabled
At least one shift exists on the date to be searched

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule page from the main menu or dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Schedule page loads successfully displaying all assigned shifts

steps.action: Locate the date search field on the schedule page
steps.expectedResult: Date search input field is visible and accessible with placeholder text indicating expected format (YYYY-MM-DD)

steps.action: Click on the date search field to activate it
steps.expectedResult: Search field is focused and ready for input; cursor appears in the field

steps.action: Enter a valid date in the correct format YYYY-MM-DD (e.g., '2024-03-15') that has scheduled shifts
steps.expectedResult: Date is entered successfully in the search field and displayed correctly

steps.action: Submit the search by pressing Enter or clicking the search button
steps.expectedResult: Search request is initiated and processed

steps.action: Observe the schedule display update
steps.expectedResult: Schedule updates dynamically without full page reload to show only shifts scheduled on the entered date within 3 seconds

steps.action: Verify that only shifts matching the searched date are displayed
steps.expectedResult: All displayed shifts have the date matching the search criteria; shifts on other dates are hidden

steps.action: Locate and click the clear search button or delete the date from the search field
steps.expectedResult: Clear search option is available and functional

steps.action: Observe the schedule after clearing the search
steps.expectedResult: Full schedule is displayed showing all shifts across all dates without page reload

postconditions: Employee remains logged in
Schedule displays all shifts without any active search filters
Search field is cleared and ready for new input
No error messages are displayed
System is ready for subsequent search operations

testCases.title: Verify rejection of invalid date input
preconditions: Employee account exists and is active in the system
Employee is logged into the application
Schedule page is loaded and accessible
Date search field is visible and functional
System has date format validation implemented (YYYY-MM-DD)

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule page
steps.expectedResult: Schedule page loads successfully with all shifts displayed

steps.action: Locate the date search input field
steps.expectedResult: Date search field is visible and accessible

steps.action: Click on the date search field to activate it
steps.expectedResult: Search field is focused and ready for input

steps.action: Enter an invalid date format (e.g., 'DD/MM/YYYY' as '15/03/2024', 'MM-DD-YYYY', 'invalid-date', or '2024-13-45')
steps.expectedResult: Invalid date input is entered in the search field

steps.action: Attempt to submit the search by pressing Enter or clicking the search button
steps.expectedResult: System validates the date format

steps.action: Observe the system response to the invalid input
steps.expectedResult: Clear error message is displayed indicating invalid date format (e.g., 'Invalid date format. Please use YYYY-MM-DD format.')

steps.action: Verify that the search was not performed
steps.expectedResult: Schedule remains unchanged showing all shifts; invalid search is not executed

steps.action: Verify the search field state
steps.expectedResult: Search field either retains the invalid input for correction or is cleared, with error message still visible

postconditions: Employee remains logged in
Schedule displays all shifts without invalid search applied
Error message is visible providing guidance on correct format
System remains stable with no crashes
Search field is ready for valid date input
